short_description: 2025–2030 program to accelerate oyster restoration by planting and monitoring intertidal/tidal-creek “source reefs” (and later subtidal work), prioritizing survivorship, recruitment, and adaptive management across South Mobile and Baldwin Counties.
case_for_change_summary: Current restoration is too slow and too small in scale; the plan focuses on rebuilding connectivity by strengthening larval source reefs (intertidal/tidal creeks), supporting sink reefs (public/subtidal), and increasing oyster availability via partnerships with farms, harvesters, hatcheries, and the Oysterkeeper program. Intertidal plantings are intended to be protected as sanctuary reefs.
